gurmukhi: ਤਬ ਅਾਨ ਲੰਕਾ ਨਾਥ || ਜੁੱਝਯੋ ਸਿਸਨ ਕੇ ਸਾਥ ||੭੮੪||
transliteration: Tab Aan Lankaa Naath|| Jujjhyo Sisan Ke Saath||784||
translation: Then Vibhishan, the Lord of Lanka, fought with the boys.784.

gurmukhi: ਲੰਕੇਸ ਕੇ ੳੁਰ ਮੋ ਤਕ ਬਾਨ || ਮਾਰਯੋ ਰਾਮ ਸਿਸਤ ਜਿ ਕਾਨ ||
transliteration: Lankes Ke Mo Tak Baan|| Mdaryo Raam Sist Ji Kaan||
translation: The sons of Ram pulling their bows shot an arrow in the heart of the king of Lanka;

gurmukhi: ਤਬ ਗਿਰਯੋ ਦਾਨਵ ਸੁ ਭੂਮਿ ਮੱਧ || ਤਿਹ ਬਿਸੁਧ ਜਾਣ ਨਹੀ ਕੀਯੋ ਬੱਧ ||੭੮੫||
transliteration: Tab Giryo Daanav Su Bhoom(i) Maddh|| Tih Bisuddh Jaan Nahikeeyo Baddh||785||
translation: That demon fell down on the earth and considering him unconscious, the boys did not kill him.785.

gurmukhi: ਤਬ ਰੁਕਯੋ ਤਾਸ ਸੁਗ੍ਰੀਵ ਅਾਨ || ਕਹਾ ਜਾਤ ਬਾਲ ਨਹੀ ਪੈਸ ਜਾਨ ||
transliteration: Tab Roukyo Taas Sougreev Aan|| Kahaa Jaat Baal Nahipais Jaan||
translation: Then Sugriva came and stopped there and said, “O boys ! where are you going? You cannot get away and remain safe.”

gurmukhi: ਤਬ ਹਣਯੋ ਬਾਣ ਤਿਹ ਭਾਲ ਤੱਕ || ਤਿਹ ਲਗਯੋ ਭਾਲ ਮੋ ਰਹਯੋ ਚੱਕ ||੭੮੬||
transliteration: Tab Hanyo Baan Tih Dhaal Takk|| Tih Lagyo Dhaal Mo Rahyo Chakk||786||
translation: Then the boys of the sage made a target of his forehead and shot his arrow which struck his forehead and feeling the sharpness of the arrow, he became actionless.786.

gurmukhi: ਚਪ ਚਲੀ ਸੈਣ ਕਪਣੀ ਸੁ ਕ੍ਰੁੱਧ || ਨਲ ਨੀਲ ਹਨੂ ਅੰਗਦ ਸੁ ਜੁੱਧ ||
transliteration: Hap Chalisain Kapad Su Kruddh|| Nal Nil Hanoo Anad Su Juddh||
translation: On seeing this the whole army was pressed and in great fury, they began to fight alongwith Nal, Neel, Hanuman and Angad;

gurmukhi: ਤਬ ਤੀਨ ਤੀਨ ਲੈ ਬਾਲ ਬਾਨ || ਤਿਹ ਹਣੋ ਭਾਲ ਮੋ ਰੋਸ ਠਾਨ ||੭੮੭||
transliteration: Tab Teen Teen Lai Baal Baan|| Tih Hane Dhaal Mo Ros Thaan||787||
translation: Then the boys took three arrows each and shot them on the foreheads of all.787.

gurmukhi: ਜੋ ਗੲੇ ਸੂਰ ਸੋ ਰਹੇ ਖੇਤ || ਜੋ ਬਚੇ ਭਾਜ ਤੇ ਹੁੲਿ ਅਚੇਤ ||
transliteration: Jo Gad Soor So Rahe Khet|| Jo Bache Bhaaj Te Hue Achet||
translation: Those who remained in the field, they embraced death an those who survived lost their senses and ran away;

gurmukhi: ਤਬ ਤਕਿ ਤਕਿ ਸਿਸ ਕੱਸਿ ਬਾਣ || ਦਲ ਹਤਯੋ ਰਾਘਵੀ ਤੱਜਿ ਕਾਣਿ ||੭੮੮||
transliteration: Tab Tak(i) Tak(i) Sis Kass(i) Baan|| Dal Hatyo Raaghavitajj(i) Kaan(i)||788||
translation: Then those boys tightly shot their arrows on their arrows on their targets and destroyed fearlessly the forces of Ram.788.

gurmukhi: ਸੁ ਕੋਪਿ ਦੇਖਿ ਕੈ ਬਲੰ ਸੁ ਕ੍ਰੁੱਧ ਰਾਘਵੀ ਸਿਸੰ || ਬਚਿੱਤ੍ਰ ਚਿੱਤ੍ਰਤ ਸਰੰ ਬਬਰਖ ਬਰਖਣੋ ਰਣੰ ||
transliteration: Su Kop(i) Dekh(i) Kai Balan Su Kruddh Raaghavisisan|| Bachittra Chittratan Saran Babarakh Barkhanndranan||
translation: Seeing the strength and rage of the boys (sons) of Ram and visualizing that volley of arrows in that wonderful type of war,

gurmukhi: ਭਭੱਜਿ ਅਾਸੁਰੀ ਸੁਤੰ ੳੁਠੰਤ ਭੈਕਰੀ ਧੁਨੰ || ਭ੍ਰਮੰਤ ਕੁੰਡਲੀ ਕ੍ਰਿਤੰ ਪਪੀੜ ਦਾਰਣੰ ਸਰੰ ||੭੮੯||
transliteration: Bhabhajj(i) Aasurisoutan Outhant Bhaikaridhounan|| Bhramannd Koundalikritan Papeed Daaranan Saran||789||
translation: The army of demons, raising terrible sound, fled away and wandered circularly.789.

gurmukhi: ਘੁਸੰਤ ਘਾੲਿਲੋ ਘਣੰ ਤਤੱਛ ਬਾਣਣੋ ਬਰੰ || ਭਭੱਜ ਕਾਤਰੋ ਕਿਤੰ ਗਜੰਤ ਜੋਧਣੋ ਜੁੱਧੰ ||
transliteration: Ghoumant Ghaailo Ghanan Tatachchh Baan-no Baran|| Bhabhajj Kaadaro Kitan Gadant Jodhano Juddhan||
translation: Many wounded warriors after being shot by sharp arrows began to wander and many warriors began to wander and many warriors began to roar and many of them becoming helpless breathed their last;
